|Heading=Management

|Order=7}}

It includes:

- directed, ''systematic'' delivery: ''prophylactic administration of oxytocin (APO)'' as soon as the child is discharged (5 to 10 IU IVL of oxytocin);

- the use of a "blood loss collection bag" just after expulsion to assess the volume of blood loss;

- normal delivery monitoring

- systematic monitoring for 2 hours in the labour ward

- artificial delivery if the placenta fails to detach 30 minutes after delivery

- macroscopic inspection of the placenta and membranes after delivery.

question.title: What is the recommended method for preventing postpartum hemorrhage (PPH)?

option_a.title: Prophylactic administration of oxytocin (APO) after delivery
option_a.description: Administering oxytocin after the child is discharged

option_b.title: Prophylactic administration of oxytocin (APO) as soon as the child is discharged
option_b.description: Administering oxytocin immediately after the child is born

option_c.title: Using a blood loss collection bag to assess blood loss
option_c.description: Collecting blood loss after the child is delivered

option_d.title: Performing a macroscopic inspection of the placenta and membranes
option_d.description: Examining the placenta and membranes after delivery

correct_option.title: B
correct_option.description: The correct letter of the answer
